intro: Madhuca moonii, commonly known as the white candlewood tree, is a tropical evergreen species native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Sapotaceae family and is characterized by its dense, dark green foliage and smooth, pale bark. The plant produces small, white flowers that bloom in clusters, followed by edible, round fruits containing a single seed. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation areas.
